name: Hanuman Chalisa
title: Shri Hanuman Chalisa
description: The most powerful and popular devotional hymn dedicated to Lord Hanuman, composed by Goswami Tulsidas. The Hanuman Chalisa consists of 40 verses (chaupais) that praise Lord Hanuman's strength, devotion, and divine powers.
significance: Removes obstacles, provides strength, courage, and protection from evil forces. Reciting it brings peace and prosperity.

seo.description: Complete Hanuman Chalisa with lyrics in Hindi and English, meaning, and benefits. Learn the proper way to recite Hanuman Chalisa.

sections.title: Shri Hanuman Chalisa
sections.content: The Hanuman Chalisa is a powerful devotional hymn of 40 verses praising Lord Hanuman, the mighty devotee of Lord Rama who embodies strength, devotion, and selfless service.

sections.title: Historical Significance
sections.content: The Hanuman Chalisa was composed by Goswami Tulsidas in the 16th century. It has been recited for centuries by millions of devotees seeking Hanuman's blessings and protection.

sections.title: Complete Chalisa Lyrics
sections.content: The complete 40 verses of Hanuman Chalisa with Doha and Chopai.

subsections.title: Doha
subsections.english:
Having polished the mirror of my heart with the dust of my guru's lotus feet,
I sing the pure fame of the best of the Raghu dynasty, which bestows the four fruits of life.

Knowing my body to be devoid of intelligence,
I remember Hanuman, the son of the Wind God.
Grant me strength, intelligence, and knowledge,
And remove all my afflictions and sins.
subsections.meaning: The opening verses invoke the guru's blessings and dedicate the Chalisa to Lord Hanuman, seeking his divine gifts.

subsections.title: Chaupai 1-10
subsections.english:
Victory to Hanuman, ocean of wisdom and virtue.
Victory to the monkey chief, illuminator of the three worlds.

Messenger of Rama, abode of incomparable strength.
Son of Anjana, named Son of the Wind.

Great hero of mighty valor, body like thunderbolt.
Destroyer of evil thoughts, companion of the good.

Golden complexioned, wearing beautiful clothes.
With ears like earrings and curly hair.

You hold Mace and Flag in your hands.
And a sacred thread of Munja grass adorns your shoulder.

You are the embodiment of Lord Shiva and son of Kesari.
You are honored by the whole world as the son of Pavan.

You are extremely wise, virtuous and clever.
You are always eager to do the work of Lord Rama.

You delight in listening to the glories of Lord Rama.
Ram, Lakshman and Sita reside in your heart.

You assumed a tiny form to appear before Sita.
You burned the entire Lanka with your fiery tail.

You brought the Sanjivini herb and revived Lakshman.
Rama embraced you with great joy.
subsections.meaning: These verses describe Hanuman's divine qualities, his relationship with Lord Rama, and his heroic deeds.

subsections.title: Chaupai 11-20
subsections.english:
Having thought of all this, you did not delay at all.
You immediately flew and reached Lanka.

The Ganga flows in your matted hair, and a garland of Mundmala adorns your neck.
Shesh Nag is wrapped around, and you wear the Makarachhala.

Om, victory to Hanuman, Omkara.
Your body is as bright as the mountain of gold.
Radhika is shining brightly.
You stand as Banamali in the creepers.

Where the Ganga manifested, the destroyer of the impurities of Kali, Shri Ganga.
By remembering her, the attachment of worldly love is broken.
She resides in the matted hair of Shiva, between the two jatas.
She destroys the heap of sins, the beloved of Shri Banwari.

The shining bright bank of the sandal mountain is fragrant.
The flute of Vrindavan is playing, the cowherds and Gwalas are smiling.
Laughing softly, the moon Chandni is shining,
Hearing the cries of the poor, the compassionate one.
subsections.meaning: These verses describe Hanuman's divine appearance, his connection with Mother Ganga, and his compassionate nature.

subsections.title: Chaupai 21-30
subsections.english:
Doha

Hearing everyone's praise, the servant Hanuman becomes pleased.
Your youthful form is the embodiment of all powers, the supreme being pervades all.

You are the supporter of the weak, your virtues are praised by all.
Whatever work one does, you grant the fruits.

You are the supreme knowledge, you are the supreme dharma.
You are the lord of the world, you are the greatest of all.

You are the servant of the people, you are the servant of the Lord of the Raghus.
Lord Rama is pleased, and makes everyone live happily.

The world and the heavens sing your praises.
Whoever worships you, says Shivanand Swami.

Sankadi, Brahmadi, Shesh Nag, Sarasur Shesh.
Kuberpati Vishnu, Raghupati Brahmdev.
Vibhishan Anant, Rudra Anant, Hanuman Anant.

Whoever destroys the enemy Hanuman, says Vibhishan with great joy.
Whoever destroys the enemy Hanuman, says Vibhishan with great joy.
subsections.meaning: These verses describe Hanuman's supreme status, his role as servant of Lord Rama, and his power to destroy enemies.

subsections.title: Chaupai 31-40
subsections.english:
The ocean of wisdom, your form is very, very wonderful.
Assuming the form of the ocean, you remain the abode of the gods.

You are the devotee Hanuman of Lord Rama, beloved of all.
You are my master, the destroyer of all obstacles.

Seeing the form of the three worlds, assuming the form of Kamal Nayan.
Seeing the form of Dasharath, seeing the form of the supreme being.

Assuming the form of a bear, the strength of Lord Raghunath.
Bajrang Bali went to see, all ghosts ran away.

Granting desired fruits to you, the son of Pavan.
Victory, victory to Hanuman, says Tulsidas.

Doha

The glory of the three worlds, the qualities are incomparable.
You can grant all boons, no one suffers.

You are the destroyer of the enemy, Hanuman is manifested.
The destroyer of the suffering of the poor, Hanuman is manifested.

You are the beloved of Lord Ram, you are his beloved.
Lord of all obstacles, Shri Ram.

You alone go to Ram, becoming the son of Pavan.
Ram gives you the kingdom, you give it to the poor.
subsections.meaning: These final verses describe Hanuman's supreme powers, his ability to grant boons, and his eternal devotion to Lord Rama.

sections.title: Benefits of Reciting Hanuman Chalisa
sections.content: The spiritual and practical benefits of regular recitation.

subsections.title: Spiritual Benefits
subsections.content: Removes negative energies, provides spiritual protection, enhances devotion, and brings peace of mind.

subsections.title: Material Benefits
subsections.content: Removes obstacles, brings success in endeavors, provides courage and strength, and protects from dangers.

sections.title: How to Recite
sections.content: Proper method and guidelines for reciting Hanuman Chalisa.

subsections.title: Best Time
subsections.content: Early morning after bath, or evening after sunset. Tuesday and Saturday are especially auspicious.

subsections.title: Procedure
subsections.content: Sit facing north or east, light a diya, offer flowers and prasad, then recite with devotion and concentration.
